abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory
            while project sustainability is considered
            "limited." Both World Bank and Borrower
            performances are rated as satisfactory. The main lessons
            flowing from this project are: The Staff Appraisal Report
            indicated that the upgrading of hospital and primary care
            facilities would be accompanied by closures or downsizing of
            the services provided in those facilities not selected for
            upgrading. The project design provided no resources or
            activities to support this streamlinin gprocess, and assumed
            that staff redeployment and resource allocation would be
            automatically implemented by the local health authorities.
            The design underestimated the level of effort and resources
            to achieve a heath service rationalization, and may have
            overlooked the technical and poltical complexity associated
            with such activities. In the future consider preparing a
            regional health plan in advance of any future health service
            rationalizationplan to ensure better integration and
            coordination amon the different elements and stakeholders in
            the planning process. In addition the project would have
            benefited from strengthened maintenance management capacity,
            a review and discussion of the main findings from technical
            assistance activities, and allocating specific resources for
            monitoring and evaluation. The District Health Management
            training program offers an effective model for designing a
            flexible recruitment of trainers. The report also evaluates
            procurement and supervision.
